boofcv.alg.feature.detect.quadblob
Class OrderPointsIntoGrid

java.lang.Object
  boofcv.alg.feature.detect.quadblob.OrderPointsIntoGrid

public class OrderPointsIntoGrid
extends java.lang.Object

Given a set of points that form an approximate grid, put them into grid order. The order shall be in a row major format moving in the counter clockwise direction. If the data is found to not be a grid then an expception is thrown. Besides ordering points, the number of rows and columns is determined. The initial starting point of the grid is arbitrary leading to the possibility that the orientation of the grid can be off.

process

public java.util.List<Point2D_F64> process(java.util.List<Point2D_F64> unordered)
                                    throws InvalidCalibrationTarget
Process the list of points and puts them into grid order

Parameters:
unordered - List of points not in any order.
Returns:
Puts which have been put into grid order.
Throws:
InvalidCalibrationTarget - Throw if the points are found to not be a grid.

findLine

public java.util.List<Point2D_F64> findLine(Point2D_F64 startPt,
                                            Point2D_F64 target,
                                            java.util.List<Point2D_F64> candidates)
Uses previously computed connections to find a row of blobs in the calibration target. The squares in the returned row are from left to right. The 'target' point provides the direction that the blobs connections should be traversed.

Parameters:
startPt - Left most point in the row.
target - Top right corner in calibration target.
Returns:
